page.title: 10Fishing, Barton
page.content: One of the most beatiful natural features of Barton Under Needwood is the Fish Pond which is situated alongside Efflinch and Gilmour Lane.It contains a variety of coarse fish.The species are Tench,Roach,Perch,Bream, Common Carp and Crucian Carp.The most common fish to be caught here in 1985 are Crucian Carp.The largest fish in the pond are Common Carp which are approximately 12 pounds in weight.Local anglers estimate that an average catch for a day's fishing is between 7 and 10 pounds.The technique used by fishermen is usually ledger or float fishing. Popular baits in use are bread,worms,casters,sweetcorn,hemp and the most popular of all, maggots. Fishing is free to residents of the village.
